questions.question_text: A corporate jump server located in the public cloud was terminated overnight because the underlying hardware failed. The next morning, developers were unable to reach environments. Which of the following is the best way to remediate the issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Explanation:
The best way to ensure that the jump server remains available even if the underlying hardware fails is to configure autoscaling with a minimum instance count of one. This ensures that if one jump server is terminated (due to hardware failure or another issue), a new one is automatically provisioned.

Selected Answer: D
D. Configuring autoscaling with a minimum number of jump servers set to one

By configuring autoscaling with a minimum number of jump servers set to one, you ensure that there is always at least one jump server available. This setup automatically provisions a new jump server in case the existing one fails, thereby maintaining continuous access for developers without manual intervention.

choices.C: Recommending developers use their laptops for development
choices.A: Setting up a virtual load balancer in front of a jump server
choices.D: Configuring autoscaling with a minimum number of jump servers set to one
choices.B: Provisioning and configuring a new jump server via a cloud console

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Explanation:
A PaaS (Platform as a Service) model provides a managed environment where developers can write, test, and deploy code without worrying about managing the OS layer, infrastructure, or runtime environment.

This is ideal for teams that need to:
âœ” Make frequent code changes
âœ” Fix bugs quickly
âœ” Avoid maintaining the OS or underlying infrastructure

questions.question_text: A development team needs to be able to make frequent code changes and to fix bugs without maintaining the OS layer. Which of the following cloud models meets the teamâ€™s requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Explanation:
If the storage appliance is exposed to the public internet via a NATed public IP, and an administrator notices strange files and a spike in network traffic, the most likely cause is that the default password was never changed.

Attackers scan public IPs for appliances with default credentials.
Many virtual storage appliances ship with weak or known default credentials, making them easy targets.
Once compromised, the appliance could be used for data exfiltration, cryptojacking, or hosting malicious files, explaining the spike in network traffic.

C. Keyword is "just deployed" no other deployments are essentially in this public cloud environment as well we can assume. We do not know what could be doing the NAT as well. Most likely this is a DDoS attack occurring and infiltration because of the weird files. We can assume no firewall was protecting this asset against these attacks.

Selected Answer: C
The storage appliance having a NAT to a public IP only indicates the appliance private IP is translated to a public IP for external access. Going with C.

Selected Answer: A
If it is nat, it is already behind a firewall. Going with default password

Selected Answer: C
C. The storage appliance has no firewall.

questions.question_text: A cloud engineer has deployed a virtual storage appliance into a public cloud environment. The storage appliance has a NAT to a public IP address. An administrator later notices there are some strange files on the storage appliance and a large spike in network traffic on the machine. Which of the following is the most likely cause?

choices.D: Data encryption is enabled, and the files are hashed.
choices.C: The storage appliance has no firewall.
choices.A: The default password is still configured on the appliance.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
The benchmark results indicate that the current vGPU profile is insufficient for high-frame-rate rendering, leading to frequent application crashes.

vGPU (Virtual GPU) profiles define the amount of GPU memory and compute resources allocated to each VM.
If a profile is too low for the workload, rendering applications may crash due to insufficient resources.
A higher vGPU profile will allocate more VRAM and GPU cores, improving stability and performance.
ðŸ”¹ How to Fix It?
âœ” Upgrade the vGPU profile to one with higher VRAM and compute power.
âœ” Match the profile to application requirements (e.g., CAD, gaming, or video rendering tools need high-end profiles).
âœ” Ensure the hypervisor supports the chosen vGPU profile.

choices.D: Configure the GPU to run in graphics mode.
choices.A: Configure the GPU to run in compute mode.
choices.B: Allocate more RAM in the VM template.

discussion.content:
D. Update the web browser to the latest version.

Explanation:

The issue arises because the systems administrator disabled older TLS versions (1.0 and 1.1) and deprecated weaker ciphers (RC4, 3DES, AES-128) on the web server. This security enhancement is necessary to protect against vulnerabilities, but older web browsers may not support the newer TLS versions or stronger ciphers.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct. The problem is that the browser doesn't support the latest standards.

questions.question_text: A systems administrator disabled TLS 1.0 and 1.1, as well as RC4, 3DES, and AES-128 ciphers for TLS 1.2, on a web server. A client now reports being unable to access the web server, but the administrator verifies that the server is online, the web service is running, and other users can reach the server as well. Which of the following should the administrator recommend the user to do FIRST?

choices.C: Establish a VPN tunnel between the computer and the web server.
choices.D: Update the web browser to the latest version.
